alert.note: Alert for Allen (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:56AM CDT until July 05 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN WILSON...NORTHERN NEOSHO...WOODSON...GREENWOOD AND ALLEN COUNTIES... At 1255 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Garnett to 5 miles east of Yates Center to 12 miles west of Eureka, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...50 to 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Chanute, Iola, Eureka, Humboldt, Yates Center, Madison, La Harpe, Gas, Moran, Toronto, Hamilton, Severy, Buffalo, Fall River, Neosho Falls, Savonburg, Elsmore, Benedict, Climax and Stark. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
